page.title: 04Field of Noss Farm.
page.content: Field of Noss Farm is situated just North of Staxigoe.There are several barns,a farm house and a garden along with 750 acres of ground.Beef cattle and sheep are the main stock.In some of the fields crops are grown for feeding the animals such as barley, silage and turnip.For storing the barley there is a moist grain tower. Once the silage has been cut it is stored in an open sided storage unit. The cattle which are reared for beef are Charolais and Aberdeen Angus. There are 270 Cheviot sheep and there is also a sheep dog for helping herd them. The 3 farm workers use various modern machines to carry out the farm work. There are tractors, combines, ploughs, a silage chopper and a four wheel drive fork lift, to mention only a few.
